meanings.definition: The condition of dying without a valid will.
meanings.sent1: When someone passes away without a will, their intestacy can lead to confusion among family members.
meanings.sent2: The intestacy of the deceased caused disagreements among relatives over the inheritance.
meanings.sent3: At the reading of the will, the lawyer joked about the intestacy, causing a few chuckles in the room.
meanings.sent4: The intestacy of the wealthy businessman left his heirs in a maze of legal complexities.
meanings.sent5: The concept of intestacy became a central theme in the family drama, highlighting the importance of estate planning.

meanings.definition: The state of having no will at the time of death.
meanings.sent1: In case of intestacy, the distribution of assets follows legal guidelines.
meanings.sent2: The intestacy of the deceased meant that the estate would be divided according to state laws.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer explained the consequences of intestacy with a touch of humor during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The intestacy of the famous actor sparked a legal battle among distant relatives.
meanings.sent5: The lack of a will resulted in intestacy, causing delays in settling the estate.
